title: Hillshire Farm Sausage Alfredo Recipe
description: This creamy sausage Alfredo pasta dish gets flavor from Cajun seasoning and smoked sausage. It's an easy dinner that's ready in about 15 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Hillshire Farm® Hillshire Farm Sausage Alfredo 4.6 (388) 291 Reviews 168 Photos This creamy sausage Alfredo pasta dinner gets some heat from Cajun seasoning, and it's ready to serve in 15 minutes. For added visual appeal, garnish with chopped tomato and sliced green onion if desired. Submitted by Hillshire Farm® Updated on November 17, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 168 168 168 168 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 8 ounces pasta, cooked, drained 1 (14 ounce) package Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage, diagonally cut into 1/4-inch slices 2 cups heavy cream 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese Directions Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes depending on shape and package directions; drain and set aside. While pasta is cooking, sauté sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, turning occasionally. Add cream and Cajun seasoning; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer gently until mixture begins to thicken, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan cheese. Add pasta to sauce and toss to serve. Recipe Tip For added fresh flavor, mix in 1 cup of frozen green peas in the last 3 to 4 minutes of cooking the pasta. I Made It Print 1,211 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Hillshire Farm Sausage Alfredo 01 of 168 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 168 Photo by  ModestWhey6285 02/18/2024 Might try again I really liked it but I went too light on the Cajun seasoning. Also the Alfredo sauce took far longer to start to thicken than anticipated. Kept the burner heat low initially because of the “gently” simmer direction. Had to gradually turn it up for the sauce to thicken. 03 of 168 Photo by  Destiny 06/04/2021 04 of 168 Photo by  Lori Wise 05/21/2021 05 of 168 Photo by  Collette Loya 04/26/2021 06 of 168 Photo by  Collette Loya 04/26/2021 07 of 168 Photo by  brandy Moss 04/10/2021 08 of 168 Photo by  Mercadeze Voight 02/05/2021 09 of 168 Photo by  Teresa Merrifield DeBusschere 01/13/2021 10 of 168 Photo by  Lyndsay Daniels Claiborne 01/09/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Creamy Pasta Toss with Smoked Sausage 62 Ratings Smoked Sausage and Butternut Squash Pasta 26 Ratings Easy Pad Thai with Shrimp and Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage 8 Ratings Famous Restaurant Alfredo Sauce 158 Ratings Easy Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo 158 Ratings Zydeco Stomp Cajun Shrimp Alfredo Creamy Smoked Salmon Pasta 250 Ratings To Die For Fettuccini Alfredo 150 Ratings Fettuccine with Butternut Squash Alfredo Sauce 1 Rating Fettuccine with Sweet Pepper-Cayenne Sauce 1,155 Ratings Homemade Chicken Fettuccine 252 Ratings Chicken Milano 2,812 Ratings Pasta with Scallops, Zucchini, and Tomatoes 424 Ratings Pasta with Peas and Sausage 432 Ratings Spinach Fettuccini with Broccoli and Ham 7 Ratings Creamy Vodka Fettuccine with Tomato, Smoked Salmon, and Caviar 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Hillshire Farm®
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes depending on shape and package directions; drain and set aside.;While pasta is cooking, sauté sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, turning occasionally.;Add cream and Cajun seasoning; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer gently until mixture begins to thicken, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in Parmesan cheese.;Add pasta to sauce and toss to serve.
